title: Suggest an alternative.....
content:
Hello,

A client is using the free Lacuna [http://www.typemotion.de/\_typographie/lacuna.php](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820234646/http:/www.typemotion.de/_typographie/lacuna.php "http://www.typemotion.de/\_typographie/lacuna.php")

It has a very limited character set. Could anybody suggest something similar to use instead/along side it? Budget not an issue. Thanks in advance.
author: apul

comments.content:
[Vida Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820234646/http:/www.stormtype.com/typefaces-fonts-shop/typefaces-611-vida-21-pro) by Storm Type Foundry.  
 [Stalemate](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820234646/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fountain/ftn_stalemate/?sample_text=Lacuna%201234567890&sample_size=36) by Stefan Hattenbach – at least if you look at the [‘a’](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820234646/http:/typophile.com/node/39504), and it has oldstyle figures (as Vida does, btw)!
Stalemate is pretty good - numbers etc share similarities. thanks.

\>Budget not an issue.

Really? Have you asked Peter to quote on extending the design? [http://www.glashaus-design.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820234646/http:/www.glashaus-design.com/ "http://www.glashaus-design.com/")

\>Budget not an issue.

Really? Have you asked Peter to quote on extending the design? [http://www.glashaus-design.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820234646/http:/www.glashaus-design.com/ "http://www.glashaus-design.com/")

Not an issue in that the client isn't necessarily looking for another free typeface, but that's a not a bad idea.
